<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>

Provide your answer with these fields.

It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_commitprog:
```c
static int lfs_dir_commitprog(lfs_t *lfs, struct lfs_commit *commit,
        const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    int err = lfs_bd_prog(lfs,
            &lfs->pcache, &lfs->rcache, false,
            commit->block, commit->off ,
            (const uint8_t*)buffer, size);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    commit->crc = lfs_crc(commit->crc, buffer, size);
    commit->off += size;
    return 0;
}
```

<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_dir_commitprog:
static int lfs_bd_prog(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_cache_t *pcache, lfs_cache_t *rcache, bool validate,
        lfs_block_t block, lfs_off_t off,
        const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    const uint8_t *data = buffer;
    LFS_ASSERT(block == LFS_BLOCK_INLINE || block < lfs->block_count);
    LFS_ASSERT(off + size <= lfs->cfg->block_size);

    while (size > 0) {
        if (block == pcache->block &&
                off >= pcache->off &&
                off < pcache->off + lfs->cfg->cache_size) {
            // already fits in pcache?
            lfs_size_t diff = lfs_min(size,
                    lfs->cfg->cache_size - (off-pcache->off));
            memcpy(&pcache->buffer[off-pcache->off], data, diff);

            data += diff;
            off += diff;
            size -= diff;

            pcache->size = lfs_max(pcache->size, off - pcache->off);
            if (pcache->size == lfs->cfg->cache_size) {
                // eagerly flush out pcache if we fill up
                int err = lfs_bd_flush(lfs, pcache, rcache, validate);
                if (err) {
                    return err;
                }
            }

            continue;
        }

        // pcache must have been flushed, either by programming and
        // entire block or manually flushing the pcache
        LFS_ASSERT(pcache->block == LFS_BLOCK_NULL);

        // prepare pcache, first condition can no longer fail
        pcache->block = block;
        pcache->off = lfs_aligndown(off, lfs->cfg->prog_size);
        pcache->size = 0;
    }

    return 0;
}
...
static int lfs_bd_flush(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_cache_t *pcache, lfs_cache_t *rcache, bool validate) {
    if (pcache->block != LFS_BLOCK_NULL && pcache->block != LFS_BLOCK_INLINE) {
        LFS_ASSERT(pcache->block < lfs->block_count);
        lfs_size_t diff = lfs_alignup(pcache->size, lfs->cfg->prog_size);
        int err = lfs->cfg->prog(lfs->cfg, pcache->block,
                pcache->off, pcache->buffer, diff);
        LFS_ASSERT(err <= 0);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }

        if (validate) {
            // check data on disk
            lfs_cache_drop(lfs, rcache);
            int res = lfs_bd_cmp(lfs,
                    NULL, rcache, diff,
                    pcache->block, pcache->off, pcache->buffer, diff);
            if (res < 0) {
                return res;
            }

            if (res != LFS_CMP_EQ) {
                return LFS_ERR_CORRUPT;
            }
        }

        lfs_cache_zero(lfs, pcache);
    }

    return 0;
}
</additional code>

explanation: I found no iteration statements with invariant (constant) controlling expressions in the provided code. The only loop present is in lfs_bd_prog: while (size > 0) — its controlling expression depends on the variable size, and size is decreased inside the loop (size -= diff) in the taken branch. In the other path of the loop the pcache is prepared so that the next iteration will enter the branch that decrements size, so the loop control is not invariant. lfs_dir_commitprog contains no loops. lfs_bd_flush contains no iteration statements. Any macro idiom such as do { ... } while (0) (e.g. possible expansion of LFS_ASSERT) would be the allowed exception (do-while with an essentially Boolean constant false). Therefore there are no fragments here that warrant investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3.
